p: The squalene content of oil was about 43.5 mg kg −1, which is within the ranges of 20–300 mg kg −1 reported for most edible oils [ 33]. Amount of squalene in seed and flour lipid fractions was comparable to oil (49.3 and 40.1 mg kg −1, respectively). Several studies have highlighted the possible beneficial effects associated with the intake of squalene from food.
